Material used.Description: Performed a yeast two-hybrid screening from a human fetal brain library to identify novel DJ-1 interaction partners.

Readout description.Result Description: TTRAP binds more strongly to M26I than to wild-type DJ-1.
TTRAP binds more strongly to L166P than to wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding strength similar to wild-type DJ-1 interaction with TTRAP.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Binding strength significantly higher than wild-type DJ-1 interaction with TTRAP.

Material used.Description: Co-immunoprecipitation experiments performed in HEK-293T cells and SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells to study binding properties of DJ-1 missense mutations.

Readout description.Result Description: TTRAP displayed a more potent interaction with M26I compared to wild-type DJ-1.
TTRAP displayed a more potent interaction with L166P compared to wild-type DJ-1, even when adjusted for lower expression levels.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in duplicate or more.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 used as a reference for binding comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or control immunoprecipitation performed on empty vector stable cells.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not described in the literature for this specific assay.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding strength similar to wild-type DJ-1 interaction with TTRAP.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Binding strength significantly higher than wild-type DJ-1 interaction with TTRAP.

Material used.Description: Viability assays performed on stable SH-SY5Y cells overexpressing TTRAP or empty vector, treated with MG132.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I significantly inhibited TTRAP protective activity upon MG132 treatment, reducing cell viability.
L166P significantly inhibited TTRAP protective activity upon MG132 treatment, reducing cell viability.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments repeated on three independent TTRAP-overexpressing and three vector-containing clones.

Basic positive control.Description: Untreated cells used as a reference for 100% viability.

Basic negative control.Description: Control cells with empty vector treated with MG132.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test used for comparing groups with reference control group.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to untreated control cells or TTRAP-overexpressing cells without mutant DJ-1 expression (>70% viability).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in cell viability compared to TTRAP-overexpressing cells without mutant DJ-1 expression (<50% viability).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Apoptosis Assay (PARP Cleavage and Caspase 3 Activation)

Material used.Description: Apoptosis measured in SH-SY5Y cells by PARP cleavage and caspase 3 activation upon MG132 treatment.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I abolished TTRAP-mediated anti-apoptotic effect, increasing PARP cleavage and caspase 3 activation.
L166P abolished TTRAP-mediated anti-apoptotic effect, increasing PARP cleavage and caspase 3 activation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments confirmed on two independent TTRAP and control clones.

Basic positive control.Description: Untreated cells used as a reference for baseline apoptosis levels.

Basic negative control.Description: Control cells with empty vector treated with MG132.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test used for significance calculation (P<0.002 for relevant comparisons).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Minimal or no increase in PARP cleavage or caspase 3 activation compared to untreated controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in PARP cleavage or caspase 3 activation compared to TTRAP-overexpressing cells without mutant DJ-1 expression.
